Package com.mackenziehigh.snowflake

Class AbstractTreeNode

java.lang.Object
com.mackenziehigh.snowflake.AbstractTreeNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITreeNode, Iterable<ITreeNode>
Direct Known Subclasses:
TreeNode
public abstract class AbstractTreeNode extends Object implements ITreeNode
An instance of this class is a node in a syntax-tree.
Author:
Mackenzie High

    • children

      public abstract ITreeNode[] children()
      This method returns an array that contains the children of this node.

      Warning: Do NOT modify the returned array!

      Specified by:
      children in interface ITreeNode
      Returns:
      the children of this node, or an empty array, if this node has no children.

    • text

      public String text()
      This method returns the text from the matched region of input that this node covers.
      Specified by:
      text in interface ITreeNode
      Returns:
      the textual form of the region of input that is covered by this node.

    • childAt

      public ITreeNode childAt(int index)
      This method returns the child-node of this node at a given index.

      Zero is the index of the left-most child of this node, if this node has children.

      Specified by:
      childAt in interface ITreeNode
      Parameters:
      index - is the index of the child-node to return.
      Returns:
      the child-node at index in the array of children.

    • childCount

      public int childCount()
      This method returns the number of children of this node.
      Specified by:
      childCount in interface ITreeNode
      Returns:
      the number of children that this node has, or zero, if this node is a leaf node.

    • iterableLeavesFirst

      public Iterable<ITreeNode> iterableLeavesFirst()
      This method returns a leaves-first iterable over the tree rooted at this node.

      In other words, this iterator visits all-leafs nodes first, from left to right.

      Specified by:
      iterableLeavesFirst in interface ITreeNode
      Returns:
      the aforedescribed iterator.

    • find

      public static ITreeNode find(Iterable<ITreeNode> iterable, String name)
      This method searches an iterable for a particular tree-node.
      Parameters:
      iterable - is the iterable to search.
      name - is the name of the rule that created the sought after tree-node.
      Returns:
      the first acceptable tree-node, or null, if no such tree-node is found.

    • findAll

      public static List<ITreeNode> findAll(Iterable<ITreeNode> iterable, String name)
      This method searches an iterable for a particular group of tree-nodes.
      Parameters:
      iterable - is the iterable to search.
      name - is the name of the rule that created the sought after tree-nodes.
      Returns:
      the found tree-nodes in the order they were found, or an empty list, if no such tree-nodes are found.
